name: Courtyard by Marriott Pittsburgh West Homestead/Waterfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this Marriott having been to many, many before. Usually when I travel Marriott is my first location of choice. For this trip, my taste was no different. It also was specifically due to the fact that this location had one of the only Whirlpool rooms in the Pittsburgh area.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with Staffing Issues

reviews.text: For a birthday treat, I took my g/f to this hotel after booking the Romance Package a week prior. This included a box of chocolates, champagne, free breakfast for two, and the whirlpool room for 2. Our stay was only for one night, obviously to enjoy the restaurants and activities in the Waterfront as well as relaxing in the room. The stay ended up being alright, but not after a # of frustrating ordeals at check-in.
reviews.title: Complications resolved ~ Thankyou Pam!

reviews.text: First Arrival: We arrived around 2:10pm, full well knowing check-in wasn't technically until 3:00pm. I figured we would see if we could check-in early and leave our bags in the room, then head out for a late lunch. As expected, the hotel didn't have a King Whirlpool room ready yet, as being in this room enables its guest to check-out late at 1:00pm. The front desk clerk told maintenance she needed a room asap, and advised us it would be approximately 20 minutes before it was ready. This was great news and not a problem at all.
reviews.title: Convenient to Pittsburgh and shopping

reviews.text: After waiting in the lobby area for 1 hour, at 3:15 we went back to the desk (Fearing they had forgotten us at shift change) and dealt with a new representative. After making a phone call and waiting 10 more minutes, he advised us the room wasn't ready yet. Hearing this and now frustrated over the lack of correct information, we headed out for our late lunch. We returned to check-in around 4:15pm (Well after the 3:00pm check-in time) and were again waiting while they called to confirm the room was available. Success! The room was ready.
reviews.title: Great for the area!

reviews.text: Payment: Holding the entire room's fee and then some in cash, I offered to pay the room with cash, already having put my card on file for the reservation. The agent said cash was fine, and then said the total was $411, for 1 night! Shocked, I asked why and apparently the $230 room required a $150 deposit if paying by cash. Not prepared for this, I then asked for another option. He said I could pay and then put a card on file which would only put a $20 hold on it. This was fine, and we proceeded. A moment later, he then said the card would not process, and said the hold was for $290! I asked why a second ago it was $20 and now it was $290 and didn't get very good response. After much disgust and preparation to leave over all of the ordeals thus far, the agent spoke to a manager.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay!

reviews.text: Our family needed to get away from Hurricane Irene and to our surprise we found this hotel in Pittsburgh. It is in a fantastic location right across the street from great shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. The Hotel is clean and the staff friendly. Our room was on the top floor and in the back of the hotel, so we had a great view of the Monongahela River. Breakfast was very good (included in price). Hotel is near a walking trail. If we're ever in Pittsburgh again we will certainly return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: My husband and I rode the 140 mile
reviews.title: Great brand new hotel right off theend of the GAP trail

reviews.text: GAP trail that currently ends at mile 140 in Homestead,PA right in front of the Marriott.
reviews.title: Central to the Waterfront Shopping Area

reviews.text: We were soaking wet,covered with mud with a heavy,muddy tandem bike.
reviews.title: Dishonest and Unprofessional.

reviews.text: Pam,the hotel desk agent greeted us warmly, gave us a room with a balcony on the 4th floor and put our tandem bike in a secure,locked place.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Nice Location, Nice Staff

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel once in October for business and wanted to stay here again but it was out of my price range. I agreed with other reviewers that this hotel is quite expensive for a 2.5 star hotel and I personally would not pay the full price to stay here. I was lucky to have won this hotel last week on priceline and I got an amazing deal. This hotel really meets the marriott experience and if you can get a good deal I would high recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel for the Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is excellent as there are a lot of things to do in the area. I was here on business so I didn't really wander around too much. There are a lot of restaurants and shopping within walking distance which makes this hotel extremely convenient.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Service, A Little Overpriced

reviews.text: The hotel very modern and well kept. The staff at the front desk were very friendly (especially PAM) and well mannered. The room was clean, modern, and the beds were really comfortable beds. I did not have a chance to check out the pool or restaurant so I cannot comment on those.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Parking is free and internet is free - which is always a bonus. In all, my stay here was excellent. I would definitely return to this hotel if I got a similar price to what I paid for on priceline.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: We stayed as a couple this past weekend as a birthday getaway for a night. Checked in at 4pm, guy at the desk was extremely nice, everything was very clean. Reserved a King jucuzzi room. Great 1st floor room, corner room right next to the side exit. Rooms was very nice looking and clean. King size bed was HUGE!!!!! Jucuzzi was very nice, but could have used some detail cleaning and one of the knobs was broken off, but it still worked fine. Tv was nice LCD, had a huge armoire, very nice decor, no view though, just dead bushes from being winter. I was hoping to have a river view. Had a few drinks in the lounge on a Saturday night around 8pm-9pm and we were the only ones there. Bartender told us they don't get busy until all the crowds from everything nearby come in for the night. Ordered extra towels and pillows, not a problem and was delivered in minutes. Checkout was as smooth as checkin, took less than a minute and I was on my way. Hotel is easily within walking distance to the entire waterfront, easy to drive in and out of. Getting there, depending on the time of day can be bad with Pittsburgh traffic. Overall a great experience, didn't meet one rude worker everyone was super nice and helpful, but it was a little overpriced.
reviews.title: Waterfront Hotel
WONDERFUL!!
reviews.text: We attended a wedding in Pittsburgh and stayed at this hotel. What a treat! It was an unusually warm early November weekend and we were able to sit on the balcony overlooking the river. There will still a few boats passing by too. Very relaxing.

reviews.title: nice clean hotel, thin walls, noisy trains
reviews.text: This is a new courtyard so its built in the new courtyard style, ie all upscale, contemporary, techno oriented and just sparkling. It also has a sweet indoor pool and decent fitness center. Typical courtyard breakfast well worth the nominal charge.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location
reviews.text: What makes this a unique, FUN courtyard is The Waterfront, a shopping / dining complex next door within walking distance. Several upscale shops, a few restaurants, and a movie theatre. There's also a walking path along the river that passes through the complex. Wish we would have had more time to enjoy it all but wedding activities kept us pretty busy.

reviews.title: Best Marriott Hotel I've Stayed In
reviews.text: The only negative here, and it was strange - they didn't have balcony furniture! I pulled out the desk chair and called for another one to be brought up. I realize not all courtyard's have furniture on their balconies but THESE balconies overlooked the river!!? Odd....

reviews.title: Unacceptable customer service - don't make reservations here.
reviews.text: The hotel room was nice and clean. We stayed on the fourth floor.

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Pittsburgh West Homestead/Waterfront Hotel Homestead
description: A perfectly situated Pittsburgh West Homestead hotel in Pittsburgh's premiere shopping and entertainment complex, the Courtyard Pittsburgh Waterfront hotel provides guests with all of the luxuries you come to expect from a Marriott hotel. The Courtyard Pittsburgh Waterfront is comprised of thoughtfully appointed guest rooms that offer you a perfect place to work, relax, and recharge. Our guests enjoy our fresh, plush bedding, modern and flexible spaces and well lit work space with free Wi-Fi at this Pittsburgh Waterfront hotel. Begin your day in the Courtyard Cafe and enjoy a full selection on the hot buffet breakfast or menu choices. Relax in the indoor pool and whirlpool or enjoy a cocktail on our outdoor patio with a dramatic view of one of the famous "Three Rivers". Convenient among Pittsburgh Waterfront hotels, we are close to many area businesses and attractions including Kennywood and Sandcastle Water Park. We invite you to experience the Courtyard Pittsburgh West Homestead when in Pittsburgh!
